Jackie, if I source /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh I can indeed run the Atlas sims.  I had taken that our of my .bashrc as DRCSim was causing problems with other robots (see below).


There are many Gazebo robots that work fine under Gazebo 2 that no longer work under Gazebo 4.  That's the problem I'm struggling with.

Take the r2_gazebo simulator for example.  Using the standard ros-indigo-simulators packages, it works fine.  With Gazebo 4, I get this same error.  So at this point, we have to have a partition for running DRCSim, and a whole separate partition for running ANY OTHER Gazebo robot that just uses the ros-indigo-simulators package because I can't have both drcsim's Gazebo 4 and ros-indigio-simulator's Gazebo2 installed at the same time.  

```
pbeeson@tardis:~/projects/sims$ . /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh
pbeeson@tardis:~/projects/sims$ roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch 
.
.
.

gzserver: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:101: boost::recursive_mutex::~recursive_mutex(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_destroy(&m)' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
```
